stream_context.summary: Kaze prototypes the art style and basic layout for Course 11—currently titled “Frantic Fleet Factory.”  During the stream he pivots the setting from a volcano construction site to an offshore oil-rig where Bowser’s minions build air-ships, and experiments with textures, colors and a dynamic ‘oil-sea’ shader while wrestling with N64 limits.

development_findings.summary: The original volcano concept is scrapped; the level is now an oil-rig construction hub sitting on a sea of oil, giving richer color options and solving brightness issues.
development_findings.quote: I guess we're making it an oil rig… that actually kind of works because this is where they built the airships.

development_findings.summary: Primary visual inspiration: Rico Harbor (steel scaffolds over liquid), Sonic’s Oil Ocean Zone (purple-orange palette), and Eldin Volcano for brightness cues.
Target color scheme shifts several times (lava reds → purple/orange/blue → purple & yellow) with ongoing tests to prevent the scene from looking too dark or monochrome.
development_findings.quote: What if we made like purple-orange and blue? …Oh, now I'm excited for this.

development_findings.summary: Creates a custom combiner-based ‘rainbow oil’ water effect; doubles mesh subdivision for finer speculars, then balances wave height/math to keep performance acceptable.
development_findings.quote: Maybe we just power through it… It’s another thing, but this actually looks so much better.

development_findings.summary: Skybox size is capped by engine; Kaze plans to program a larger skybox later instead of modeling it to avoid pop-in.
development_findings.quote: We literally can't do anything about the skybox until the end. I actually have to increase the draw distance here just so it looks semi-okay.

development_findings.summary: Level will likely be split into four smaller rig platforms connected by pipes to control polygon count and draw-distance pop-in.

Mission outline retained: 1) troll working minions, 2) minion strike, 3) boss sent to break strike, 4) power-generator area, 5) red-coin scaffold run, 6) 8-bit pipe underground. Excavation pit concept dropped.
Textures sourced from Mario Sunshine (‘DK fence’, construction planks).  Kaze re-colors them in Photoshop and bakes vertex lighting inside Blender.
Performance goal: stay around 10 k triangles; noted 25 fps drops during heavy VFX testing; considers multiplayer impact.
Uses Blender with Fast64 exporter; edits custom C code for render combiners and water behaviour.

context_findings.summary: Kaze values concise communication and rewrites tweets until they're minimal.
context_findings.quote: Being concise is one of the skills I value the most.

context_findings.summary: Believes finishing a major SM64 hack requires a degree of ‘mental illness’; jokes about thriving on criticism.
context_findings.quote: If you want to finish a Mario 64 hack you need to be mentally ill.

context_findings.summary: Currently works professionally as a C++ programmer on a 35-hour week with mandated ‘mental health’ policies, which he finds overly protective.
context_findings.quote: They are so penetrant about mental health… I'm technically still self-employed, but they give me rights.

context_findings.summary: Mentions spouse Zeina; she missed most of stream to write overdue wedding thank-you cards; later chats and invites him to dinner.
Expresses tongue-in-cheek views on child labour in games like Fortnite, Minecraft and Roblox, framing them as ‘successful business strategy’.
context_findings.quote: Child labor is the best business strategy… those are the three most popular games of all time.

biobak.summary: Suggests making infrastructure bright yellow to contrast oil; later proposes black-orange highlights and effect intensity tweaks, which Kaze adopts.
biobak.quote: Try making the factory infrastructure bright yellow.

biobak.summary: Provides ongoing feedback on color saturation and effect subtlety; recognized by Kaze as helper with level visuals.

zeina.summary: Absent for most of stream writing wedding thank-you cards; later joins chat, bakes cake/pizza, and schedules family dinner with Kaze.

key_stories.title: Volcano to Oil-Rig Pivot
key_stories.summary: Kaze starts designing a lava-filled construction zone but struggles with dull, grainy visuals. Chat (notably Biobak) suggests an oil-rig theme, providing new color opportunities and contextual sense for air-ship production.
key_stories.challenge: Initial volcano palette felt too dark and monochrome.
key_stories.process: Tested alternate references (Skyward Sword, Mario Odyssey), finally swapped lava for an oil sea and re-planned layout.
key_stories.outcome: Setting officially changed to an offshore oil-rig; excavation pit removed; new mission & art direction established.
key_stories.key_quote: I guess we're making it an oil rig… that actually kind of works because this is where the ships were actually built.

key_stories.title: Building the Rainbow Oil Shader
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants oil that shimmers with rainbow highlights. Initial combiner code renders incorrectly and tanks performance. He doubles mesh subdivision and rewrites the combiner to mix texture with prim color based on shade alpha.
key_stories.challenge: Achieving visually rich ‘oil’ without exceeding N64 limits.
key_stories.process: Iterative testing of combiner formulas, adjusting wave math, balancing vertex count vs performance.
key_stories.outcome: Effect accepted with reduced intensity and 25–30 fps; may optimize further.
key_stories.key_quote: We did all this to get away from lava just to make the level look like lava again.

key_stories.title: Managing Polygon Budget
key_stories.summary: Large single-platform designs risk excessive triangles and draw-distance issues. Kaze considers four separate rigs connected by long pipes to split geometry.
key_stories.challenge: Avoiding lag and pop-in on real N64 hardware.
key_stories.process: Analyzed Rusty Bucket Bay and previous ‘tree’ level for lessons; sketched multi-area plan.
key_stories.outcome: Provisional decision to segment level; final structure pending.
key_stories.key_quote: We need to make distinct areas… The question is how to make these areas distinct without Bowser turning bad.
